text: ਜੋਗੀ ਭੋਗੀ ਕਾਪੜੀ ਕਿਆ ਭਵਹਿ ਦਿਸੰਤਰ ॥

translation.text: Why do the Yogis, the revellers, and the beggars wander in foreign lands?

transliteration.text: jōgī bhōgī kāparī kiā bhavah disantar .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਗੁਰ ਕਾ ਸਬਦੁ ਨ ਚੀਨ੍ਹਹੀ ਤਤੁ ਸਾਰੁ ਨਿਰੰਤਰ ॥੩॥

translation.text: They do not understand the Word of the Guru's Shabad, and the essence of excellence within them. ||3||

transliteration.text: gur kā sabad n chīnhahī tat sār nirantar .3.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

text: ਪੰਡਿਤ ਪਾਧੇ ਜੋਇਸੀ ਨਿਤ ਪੜ੍ਹਹਿ ਪੁਰਾਣਾ ॥

translation.text: The Pandits, the religious scholars, the teachers and astrologers, and those who endlessly read the Puraanas,

transliteration.text: pandit pādhē jōisī nit parhah purānā .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

text: ਅੰਤਰਿ ਵਸਤੁ ਨ ਜਾਣਨ੍ਹੀ ਘਟਿ ਬ੍ਰਹਮੁ ਲੁਕਾਣਾ ॥੪॥

translation.text: do not know what is within; God is hidden deep within them. ||4||

transliteration.text: antar vasat n jānanhī ghat braham lukānā .4.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਇਕਿ ਤਪਸੀ ਬਨ ਮਹਿ ਤਪੁ ਕਰਹਿ ਨਿਤ ਤੀਰਥ ਵਾਸਾ ॥

translation.text: Some penitents perform penance in the forests, and some dwell forever at sacred shrines.

transliteration.text: ik tapasī ban mah tap karah nit tīrath vāsā .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. text: ਆਪੁ ਨ ਚੀਨਹਿ ਤਾਮਸੀ ਕਾਹੇ ਭਏ ਉਦਾਸਾ ॥੫॥

translation.text: The unenlightened people do not understand themselves - why have they become renunciates? ||5||

transliteration.text: āp n chīnah tāmasī kāhē bhaē udāsā .5.

text: ਇਕਿ ਬਿੰਦੁ ਜਤਨ ਕਰਿ ਰਾਖਦੇ ਸੇ ਜਤੀ ਕਹਾਵਹਿ ॥

translation.text: Some control their sexual energy, and are known as celibates.

transliteration.text: ik bind jatan kar rākhadē sē jatī kahāvah .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਬਿਨੁ ਗੁਰ ਸਬਦ ਨ ਛੂਟਹੀ ਭ੍ਰਮਿ ਆਵਹਿ ਜਾਵਹਿ ॥੬॥

translation.text: But without the Guru's Word, they are not saved, and they wander in reincarnation. ||6||

transliteration.text: bin gur sabad n shūtahī bhram āvah jāvah .6.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਇਕਿ ਗਿਰਹੀ ਸੇਵਕ ਸਾਧਿਕਾ ਗੁਰਮਤੀ ਲਾਗੇ ॥

translation.text: Some are householders, servants, and seekers, attached to the Guru's Teachings.

transliteration.text: ik girahī sēvak sādhikā guramatī lāgē .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਨਾਮੁ ਦਾਨੁ ਇਸਨਾਨੁ ਦ੍ਰਿੜੁ ਹਰਿ ਭਗਤਿ ਸੁ ਜਾਗੇ ॥੭॥

translation.text: They hold fast to the Naam, to charity, to cleansing and purification; they remain awake in devotion to the Lord. ||7||

transliteration.text: nām dān isanān drir har bhagat s jāgē .7.

text: ਗੁਰ ਤੇ ਦਰੁ ਘਰੁ ਜਾਣੀਐ ਸੋ ਜਾਇ ਸਿਞਾਣੈ ॥

translation.text: Through the Guru, the Gate of the Lord's Home is found, and that place is recognized.

transliteration.text: gur tē dar ghar jānīai sō jāi siñānai .

text: ਨਾਨਕ ਨਾਮੁ ਨ ਵੀਸਰੈ ਸਾਚੇ ਮਨੁ ਮਾਨੈ ॥੮॥੧੪॥

translation.text: Nanak does not forget the Naam; his mind has surrendered to the True Lord. ||8||14||

transliteration.text: nānak nām n vīsarai sāchē man mānai .8.14.

text: ਆਸਾ ਮਹਲਾ ੧ ॥

translation.text: Aasaa, First Mehl:

transliteration.text: āsā mahalā 1 .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਮਨਸਾ ਮਨਹਿ ਸਮਾਇਲੇ ਭਉਜਲੁ ਸਚਿ ਤਰਣਾ ॥

translation.text: Stilling the desires of the mind, the mortal truly crosses over the terrifying world-ocean.

transliteration.text: manasā manah samāilē bhaujal sach taranā .

text: ਆਦਿ ਜੁਗਾਦਿ ਦਇਆਲੁ ਤੂ ਠਾਕੁਰ ਤੇਰੀ ਸਰਣਾ ॥੧॥

translation.text: In the very beginning, and throughout the ages, You have been the Merciful Lord and Master; I seek Your Sanctuary. ||1||

transliteration.text: ād jugād daiāl tū thākur tērī saranā .1.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਤੂ ਦਾਤੌ ਹਮ ਜਾਚਿਕਾ ਹਰਿ ਦਰਸਨੁ ਦੀਜੈ ॥

translation.text: You are the Giver, and I am a mere beggar. Lord, please grant me the Blessed Vision of Your Darshan.

transliteration.text: tū dātau ham jāchikā har darasan dījai .

text: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਨਾਮੁ ਧਿਆਈਐ ਮਨ ਮੰਦਰੁ ਭੀਜੈ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: The Gurmukh meditates on the Naam; the temple of his mind resounds with joy. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: guramukh nām dhiāīai man mandar bhījai .1. rahāu .

translation.text: Renouncing false greed, one comes to realize the Truth.

text: ਗੁਰ ਕੈ ਸਬਦਿ ਸਮਾਈਐ ਪਰਮਾਰਥੁ ਜਾਣੈ ॥੨॥

translation.text: So let yourself be absorbed in the Word of the Guru's Shabad, and know this supreme realization. ||2||

text: ਇਹੁ ਮਨੁ ਰਾਜਾ ਲੋਭੀਆ ਲੁਭਤਉ ਲੋਭਾਈ ॥

translation.text: This mind is a greedy king, engrossed in greed.

text: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਲੋਭੁ ਨਿਵਾਰੀਐ ਹਰਿ ਸਿਉ ਬਣਿ ਆਈ ॥੩॥

translation.text: The Gurmukh eliminates his greed, and comes to an understanding with the Lord. ||3||

transliteration.text: guramukh lōbh nivārīai har siu ban āī .3.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਕਲਰਿ ਖੇਤੀ ਬੀਜੀਐ ਕਿਉ ਲਾਹਾ ਪਾਵੈ ॥

translation.text: Planting the seeds in the rocky soil, how can one reap a profit?

transliteration.text: kalar khētī bījīai kiu lāhā pāvai .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਮਨਮੁਖੁ ਸਚਿ ਨ ਭੀਜਈ ਕੂੜੁ ਕੂੜਿ ਗਡਾਵੈ ॥੪॥

translation.text: The self-willed manmukh is not pleased with Truth; the false are buried in falsehood. ||4||

transliteration.text: manamukh sach n bhījaī kūr kūr gadāvai .4.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

text: ਲਾਲਚੁ ਛੋਡਹੁ ਅੰਧਿਹੋ ਲਾਲਚਿ ਦੁਖੁ ਭਾਰੀ ॥

translation.text: So renounce greed - you are blind! Greed only brings pain.

transliteration.text: lālach shōdah andhihō lālach dukh bhārī .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

text: ਸਾਚੌ ਸਾਹਿਬੁ ਮਨਿ ਵਸੈ ਹਉਮੈ ਬਿਖੁ ਮਾਰੀ ॥੫॥

translation.text: When the True Lord dwells within the mind, the poisonous ego is conquered. ||5||

transliteration.text: sāchau sāhib man vasai haumai bikh mārī .5.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. text: ਦੁਬਿਧਾ ਛੋਡਿ ਕੁਵਾਟੜੀ ਮੂਸਹੁਗੇ ਭਾਈ ॥

translation.text: Renounce the evil way of duality, or you shall be plundered, O Siblings of Destiny.

transliteration.text: dubidhā shōd kuvātarī mūsahugē bhāī .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਅਹਿਨਿਸਿ ਨਾਮੁ ਸਲਾਹੀਐ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸਰਣਾਈ ॥੬॥

translation.text: Day and night, praise the Naam, in the Sanctuary of the True Guru's protection. ||6||

transliteration.text: ahinis nām salāhīai satigur saranāī .6.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਮਨਮੁਖ ਪਥਰੁ ਸੈਲੁ ਹੈ ਧ੍ਰਿਗੁ ਜੀਵਣੁ ਫੀਕਾ ॥

translation.text: The self-willed manmukh is a rock, a stone. His life is cursed and useless.

transliteration.text: manamukh pathar sail hai dhrig jīvan phīkā .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਜਲ ਮਹਿ ਕੇਤਾ ਰਾਖੀਐ ਅਭ ਅੰਤਰਿ ਸੂਕਾ ॥੭॥

translation.text: No matter now long a stone is kept under water, it still remains dry at its core. ||7||

transliteration.text: jal mah kētā rākhīai abh antar sūkā .7.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਹਰਿ ਕਾ ਨਾਮੁ ਨਿਧਾਨੁ ਹੈ ਪੂਰੈ ਗੁਰਿ ਦੀਆ ॥

translation.text: The Name of the Lord is the treasure; the Perfect Guru has given it to me.

transliteration.text: har kā nām nidhān hai pūrai gur dīā .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਨਾਨਕ ਨਾਮੁ ਨ ਵੀਸਰੈ ਮਥਿ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤੁ ਪੀਆ ॥੮॥੧੫॥

translation.text: O Nanak, one who does not forget the Naam, churns and drinks in the Ambrosial Nectar. ||8||15||

transliteration.text: nānak nām n vīsarai math anmrit pīā .8.15.

text: ਆਸਾ ਮਹਲਾ ੧ ॥

translation.text: Aasaa, First Mehl:

transliteration.text: āsā mahalā 1 .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਚਲੇ ਚਲਣਹਾਰ ਵਾਟ ਵਟਾਇਆ ॥

translation.text: The travellers travel from one road to another.

transliteration.text: chalē chalanahār vāt vatāiā .

text: ਧੰਧੁ ਪਿਟੇ ਸੰਸਾਰੁ ਸਚੁ ਨ ਭਾਇਆ ॥੧॥

translation.text: The world is engrossed in its entanglements, and does not appreciate the Truth. ||1||

transliteration.text: dhandh pitē sansār sach n bhāiā .1.

text: ਕਿਆ ਭਵੀਐ ਕਿਆ ਢੂਢੀਐ ਗੁਰ ਸਬਦਿ ਦਿਖਾਇਆ ॥

translation.text: Why wander around, and why go searching, when the Guru's Shabad reveals Him to us?

transliteration.text: kiā bhavīai kiā dhūdhīai gur sabad dikhāiā .

text: ਮਮਤਾ ਮੋਹੁ ਵਿਸਰਜਿਆ ਅਪਨੈ ਘਰਿ ਆਇਆ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: Leaving behind egotism and attachment, I have arrived at my own home. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: mamatā mōh visarajiā apanai ghar āiā .1. rahāu .

text: ਸਚਿ ਮਿਲੈ ਸਚਿਆਰੁ ਕੂੜਿ ਨ ਪਾਈਐ ॥

translation.text: Through Truth, one meets the True One; He is not obtained through falsehood.

transliteration.text: sach milai sachiār kūr n pāīai .

text: ਸਚੇ ਸਿਉ ਚਿਤੁ ਲਾਇ ਬਹੁੜਿ ਨ ਆਈਐ ॥੨॥

translation.text: Centering your consciousness on the True Lord, you shall not have to come into the world again. ||2||

transliteration.text: sachē siu chit lāi bahur n āīai .2.

text: ਮੋਇਆ ਕਉ ਕਿਆ ਰੋਵਹੁ ਰੋਇ ਨ ਜਾਣਹੂ ॥

translation.text: Why do you weep for the dead? You do not know how to weep.

transliteration.text: mōiā kau kiā rōvah rōi n jānahū .

text: ਰੋਵਹੁ ਸਚੁ ਸਲਾਹਿ ਹੁਕਮੁ ਪਛਾਣਹੂ ॥੩॥

translation.text: Weep by praising the True Lord, and recognize His Command. ||3||

translation.text: Blessed is the birth of one who is destined to abide by the Lord's Command.
